digitalGrampanchayat.title: Digital Grampanchayat
digitalGrampanchayat.subtitle: A mission to deliver transparent, efficient and citizen-friendly services using technology.

vision.title: Vision
vision.desc: Build a digitally-enabled Gram Panchayat where every citizen can access services online, track requests, and engage with the local administration easily.

objectives.title: Objectives
items: Online access to certificates and applications
Transparent service tracking and updates
Digitized records and paperless governance
Citizen engagement through announcements and feedback

services.title: Digital Services
items: Online certificates (Birth/Death/Residence)
Notices and announcements portal
RTS services and downloadable forms
Online grievance and feedback
Digital payments (coming soon)
Service tracking dashboard

villageOverview.title: Khadak Ozar Village - A Glimpse
villageOverview.description: Khadak Ozar Gram Panchayat is a rural self-governance institution under Nashik District Council, Chandwad Panchayat Samiti. The village has a population of 3487, with Khadak Ozar being the main village and Gurhale settlement being independently located.

categories.title: Education
items: Z.P. Marathi School Khadak Ozar (Class 1 to 7)
Z.P. Marathi School Gurhale
Secondary School Khadak Ozar (Class 5 to 10)

categories.title: Health
items: Health Sub-Center – 01
Anganwadi Centers – 5 (1 Khadak Ozar, 2 Dr. Babasaheb Ambedkar Nagar, 3 Jambhlicha Malla & 4 Vishnuwadi 5 Gurhale)

categories.title: Water Supply
items: Individual tap connections for families under 'Har Ghar Jal Har Ghar Nal'
R.O. ATM facility

categories.title: Other Facilities
items: Weather Center: Weather information available on mobile in the village
Telephone facility and internet connectivity available
Social Hall: 3 social halls in the village where public programs, weddings, annual rituals, religious ceremonies take place
Cremation ground shed, death ritual shed available
CCTV: CCTV cameras installed throughout the village and under surveillance
Gymnasium: Independent gymnasium building available in Khadak Ozar village
Public playground: Independent ground for cricket and other sports in the village
Aaple Sarkar Service Center - Setu Center: A Setu center in Khadak Ozar village providing documents and online facilities at one place

crops.title: Main Crops
items: Grapes, sugarcane, pomegranate, onion, tomato, capsicum and vegetable crops
Large scale grape orchards in the village
Solar dryers for women entrepreneurship development

places.name: Kedrai Mata Dam
places.description: Kedrai Mata Dam is a dam located near Khadak Ozar village in Chandwad taluka of Nashik district, built on Vinta river and famous for Kedrai Mata temple. The awakened deity of Mother Kedrai is located near this dam. This dam provides water supply to villages in the surrounding area.

features.title: Dam and Surroundings
items: Location: Kedrai Mata Dam is located in Chandwad taluka of Nashik district, near Khadak Ozar village
River: This dam is built on Vinta river
Reason for Fame: Due to being near the temple, this dam is named Kedrai Mata Dam
Water Supply: This dam provides water supply as a water carrier to Jopul, Khadak Ozar, Wadali Bhoi and surrounding villages in the five kos area

places.name: Kedrai Mata Temple Khadak Ozar
places.description: Famous Kedrai Mata is an awakened deity located about two kilometers from Khadak Ozar village in Chandwad taluka. This deity is located 6 km from Wadali Bhoi village near Mumbai-Agra National Highway No. 3. There is huge crowd here on full moon, new moon, Tuesday, Friday and Sunday.

features.title: Special Features
items: There is a belief among devotees since ancient times that if couples cannot have children, taking a bath seven times in the holy pond here fulfills their wishes
This goddess is famous for fulfilling vows
Ancient temples of Shani, Rahu, Ketu are located near Kedrai Mata temple
Four-faced Hanuman idol in front is very beautiful and there is a Shivalinga in the nearby temple
Ancient lamp tower can be seen on the hill in front. It should be from Shivaji's era
Banyan and Peepal trees in the temple premises add to the glory of the deity
This deity located on the banks of Vinta river is very peaceful, beautiful and pleasant

specialFeatures.title: Special Features
items: Kedrai Mata is famous as an awakened deity in Khadak Ozar village in Chandwad taluka of Nashik district in Maharashtra state

Continuous Hari Naam Saptah has been running in the village for the last 90 years and this year in April 2025, it will complete 90 years continuously and we will celebrate the golden jubilee in another 10 years
Khadak Ozar - A small but ideal, prosperous, and historically heritage-preserving village!

aboutUs.title: About Us
aboutUs.content: Our Gram Panchayat works towards the development and welfare of the village community. With transparency and people's participation, we aim to provide essential services, implement government schemes, and promote rural development.

members.name: Shri. Jayakumar Gore
members.designation: Hon'ble Minister, Rural Development and Panchayat Raj

members.name: Shri. Yogesh Kadam
members.designation: Hon'ble Minister of State, Rural Development and Panchayat Raj

members.name: Shri. Eknath Dawale
members.designation: Principal Secretary, Rural Development and Panchayat Raj

events.title: Events
events.description: Stay updated with the latest events and activities in our village
events.noEventsMessage: Check back later for upcoming events and activities.
events.officeHours: Office Hours: Monday to Friday, 9:00 AM - 5:00 PM

shaleySamiti.title: Shaley Vyavasthapan Samiti
shaleySamiti.description: The School Management Committee is responsible for overseeing the educational activities and development of schools in our village.
responsibilitiesList: Oversee school operations and educational activities
Ensure quality education for all students
Ensure proper utilization of government funds
shaleySamiti.additionalInfo: This committee works closely with school administration, teachers, and parents to ensure the best educational outcomes for our children.

janArogyaSamiti.title: Jan Arogya Samiti
janArogyaSamiti.subtitle: Public Health Department, Nashik under Ayushman Bharat - Arogya Vardhini Sub-Center Khadak Ozar, Tal. Bandhav (Nashik)
janArogyaSamiti.description: The Jan Arogya Samiti is dedicated to improving public health and healthcare services in our village community.
responsibilitiesList: Promote health awareness and education in the community
Organize health camps and medical check-ups
Coordinate with healthcare providers and hospitals
Monitor public health programs and initiatives
Ensure access to healthcare services for all villagers
Promote maternal and child health programs
Organize vaccination drives and health campaigns
janArogyaSamiti.officeHours: Office Hours: Monday to Friday, 9:00 AM - 5:00 PM
janArogyaSamiti.additionalInfo: This committee works under the Ayushman Bharat initiative to ensure comprehensive healthcare services for all community members.

rts.title: Right to Service (RTS)
rts.subtitle: Maharashtra Right To Service Act
rts.description1: The Maharashtra Right to Public Services Act, 2015 is enacted and is in force since 28.04.2015 to ensure that notified services are provided to the citizens in a transparent, speedy and time-bound manner by various Government Departments and Public Authorities under the Government. Its objective is to provide easy, prompt and time bound services to the citizens.
rts.description2: The Maharashtra State Commission for Right to Public Service has been constituted under the above Act to monitor, coordinate, control and improve the public services being provided by the Government. The Commission consists of a Chief Commissioner and six Commissioners. The headquarter of the Commission is at the New Administrative Building, Opposite Mantralaya, Mumbai and the Divisional Offices of the Commissioners are at the six Divisional Headquarters.
rts.description3: If any notified service is not provided to any eligible person within stipulated time or is rejected without proper grounds, the concerned person may file 1st and 2nd appeals with the higher authorities and if he is not satisfied with their decision, he may prefer third appeal to the Commission. The erring officer is liable for a penalty up to Rs 5000/- per case.
